intro: Venidium macrospermum, commonly known as the large-seeded venidium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its showy, yellow flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences at the base of the plant. Venidium macrospermum produces large, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds, adapting to its habitat in humid, tropical environments.
